item.title: Semi-Discrete Optimal Transport for Texture Synthesis
item.description: Texture synthesis is a technique that consists in generating some realistic textures by imitating the patterns of a given exemplar texture. It plays a crucial role in many domains such as computer graphics, where the synthesis quality directly impacts the visual quality and the realism of graphical environments. The objective is to have a realistic replica in a visual sense but with original content: we don’t simply want to copy parts of the original texture for the sake of visual quality and realism.
